a vps box is more expensive than shared hosting because of control. you can install whatever you want on your vps and configure it your way. with shared hosting, you're limited to what the hosting providers puts on there and you hope it's compatible with your setup. it's worth the extra few bucks.
whether it's php or rails, i would always go with a platform-as-a-service nowadays. it's just so much nicer to focus on your app and not have to be a computer-janitor for your servers too
i found this sweet list from a user on TechCrunch about a bunch of PaaS's for different languages: http://d-ro.ch/2011/01/paas-web-hosters/
imo, heroku does it the best and everyone is racing to catch up with them
